title: CNN reporter describes local accounts of Poland explosion that left 2 dead
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports from Przewodow, Poland, where Polish officials have confirmed two people died following an explosion near the Ukraine border.

title: McCarthy wins GOP nomination for speaker
description: The House Republican conference voted for House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy to be its leader after an underwhelming midterm election performance launched a search among conservatives for a challenger.

title: Why Australia's elite basketballer is ready to tell the world he is gay
description: One of the best feelings in the world is playing a game of professional basketball while on peak form.

title: Lonely Planet reveals its top destinations for 2023
description: Guidebook company Lonely Planet has revealed its 18th annual "Best in Travel" list.

title: Marijuana smoke harms lungs in tobacco smokers, study finds
description: Smoking weed while being a tobacco smoker may increase damage to the respiratory system, a new study found.

title: Elon Musk clashes with and fires Twitter employees in tweets
description: Elon Musk has publicly clashed with a growing number of Twitter employees about the state of the platform, and fired at least one of them in a tweet, in an unusually visible sign of corporate chaos after his $44 billion takeover of the influential company.

title: NATO member Poland calls emergency meeting of its national security officials
description: Projectiles have reportedly killed two people after hitting a farm in Poland near the border with Ukraine on Tuesday, according to Polish media.

title: Former NATO ambassador explains why projectiles landing in Poland is not surprising
description: Two people are reported killed after projectiles are reported to have hit a farm in Poland, near the border with Ukraine. The origin of the projectiles is unclear. Former NATO ambassador Kurt Volker gives his reaction.

title: NASA gears up to launch historic moon mission after mega rocket sustained hurricane damage
description: The historic Artemis I mission — an uncrewed test flight around the moon that will make use of the most powerful operational rocket in the world — could finally take flight this week.

title: New marine life uncovered at bottom of sea floor
description: Scientists from Australia's Museums Victoria Research Institute have discovered new deep-sea creatures while exploring the depths of the Indian Ocean.

title: These are the celebs impacted by the collapse of FTX
description: The implosion of cryptocurrency exchange FTX has left investors grappling with the aftershocks. CNN's Christine Romans reports.

title: Coors Light's new nail polish changes color if your beer is cold enough to drink
description: Fact: No one likes warm beer.

title: Missiles strike Poland, killing two people. Their origin is unclear.
Grammy nominations 2023: See the list of nominees
description: The nominations for the 2023 Grammy Awards are being revealed on Tuesday.

title: Climate activists in Austria throw black substance at Klimt painting 'Death and Life'
description: Climate protesters in Austria have thrown a black substance over Gustav Klimt's painting "Death and Life," in the latest act targeting renowned works of art across the world.

title: US intelligence suggests Russia put off announcing Kherson retreat until after midterm elections
Taylor Swift fans irate at Ticketmaster, which denies reports tour pre-sale broke the site
description: There's some bad blood brewing between Taylor Swift fans and Ticketmaster.

title: Canada's Trudeau deletes tweet falsely claiming Iran has sentenced 15,000 protesters to death
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau deleted a tweet containing false information on mass death sentences in Iran, after a viral campaign on social media circulated the fake news.

title: University of Virginia grapples with the killing of 3 football players
description: The University of Virginia canceled classes Tuesday as it "continues to work through the emotional toll" of Sunday's shooting that left three of the school's football players dead and two other people injured.

title: FTX crash is eerily similar to the Bernie Madoff scandal, ex-regulator says
description: In the span of just three years, Sam Bankman-Fried built FTX into a massive crypto exchange backed by marquee investors and valued at $32 billion. It took mere days for all of that to implode in a sprawling bankruptcy filing.

title: We tried Apple's new SOS tool for when you don't have cell service
description: When Apple announced at its closely-watched September product launch event that it would soon introduce an Emergency SOS feature powered by a network of satellites orbiting above Earth, Brooklyn probably wasn't the secluded location most had in mind for using it.

title: Dramatic footage shows water overflow in flash flood
description: Water gushed out of the Wyangala dam in Australia's New South Wales state as flash flooding hit the region.

title: Morrissey upsets crowd after ending concert 30 minutes in
description: Morrissey abruptly ended his concert at the Greek Theatre in Los Angeles just 30 minutes in.

title: Reporter reduced to giggles by baby elephant
description: A baby elephant uses its trunk to tickle a reporter until he erupts in giggles. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Biden administration working to clean up Milley remarks on Ukraine diplomacy
description: The Biden administration is working to reassure the Ukrainian government, outside experts, and former US officials that it will not push Ukraine to imminently seek a diplomatic outcome to the war with Russia after the most senior US general publicly pushed for a more urgent diplomatic effort this winter.

title: Oatly plans job cuts as investors sour
description: Oat milk brand Oatly is planning to cut jobs as coronavirus restrictions in Asia dampen its sales forecast for this year.

title: First strong Santa Ana winds of the season bring critical fire danger to California
description: The first strong Santa Ana occurrence of the season is bringing harsh winds across Southern California through Thursday, setting the stage for critical fire conditions and the potential for a blaze to spread rapidly.

title: 'Mr. President, don't run again': Conservative pundits react to Trump's 'special announcement'
description: After the Republican Party's underwhelming performance in the 2022 midterm elections, conservative media personalities and pundits cast doubt that former President Donald Trump will be the GOP's best presidential candidate for 2024.

title: Israel reveals US probe into Shireen Abu Akleh's death but says it 'will not cooperate'
description: A top Israeli official has confirmed the existence of a US investigation into the killing of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh but said Israel's government would not cooperate with the American probe, calling it a "mistake."

title: How to build a new generation of Biden-McCain friendships
description: The late Republican Sen. John McCain of Arizona was a close friend of President Joe Biden when they served together in the Senate, according to his wife Cindy McCain. In a video she recorded during Biden's presidential campaign, she recalled how during family picnics in Biden's backyard, "they would just sit and joke. It was like a comedy show, sometimes, to watch the two of them."

title: Iranian football legend Ali Daei refuses to attend World Cup in solidarity with protesters
description: Iran's record international goalscorer Ali Daei said on Monday that he refused an invitation to attend the World Cup in Qatar next week to stand in solidarity with Iranian protesters.

title: Russian missiles strike Kyiv after Zelensky outlines conditions for peace at G20 summit
description: Russian missile strikes hit residential buildings in Kyiv on Tuesday, officials there said, and explosions were heard in other Ukrainian cities in what appeared to be the first major aerial attack since Moscow retreated from the key city of Kherson last week.

title: 'Shook me profoundly': Michelle Obama shares her thoughts on Trump 2016 win
description: Juana Summers, co-host of NPR's All Things Considered, joins "CNN This Morning" to discuss her interview with former first lady Michelle Obama.

title: Rihanna would like Beyoncé to model for Savage X Fenty
description: If anyone has the power to manifest it's Rihanna, right?

title: Father of ex-UVA football player accused of shooting 3 students speaks out
description: Christopher Darnell Jones Jr.'s father spoke out after officials said his son is suspected of fatally shooting three current UVA football players and wounding two others at the school's main campus in Charlottesville as a bus returned from a class field trip.

title: Hobbs defeats election denier in AZ governor's race
description:
• Republicans close in on 218 seats that would deliver them House majority
• John King: What Hobbs' projected win in Arizona means for Democrats

title: Hobbs defeats election denier in AZ governor's race
Watch Zelensky's remarks to G20 summit
description: During remarks given at the G20 summit, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky compared the battle for Kherson to D-Day while laying out his peace plan with Russia. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports.

title: Scientists have used mushrooms to make biodegradable computer chips
description: Foraging for fungi may not only mean mushrooms are on the menu. New research has shown that mushroom skins could provide a biodegradable alternative to some plastics used in batteries and computer chips, making them easier to recycle.

title: Walmart agrees to $3.1 billion opioid settlement framework
description: Walmart agreed to the framework of a $3.1 billion settlement, which resolves allegations from multiple states' attorneys general that the company failed to regulate opioid prescriptions contributing to the nationwide opioid crisis.

title: What happens when an army of bikers invades an Italian resort
description: In the Emilia Romagna region, on Italy's Adriatic coast, summers are languid, sultry, and full of opportunities to dine, drink, dance, swim, relax and replenish.  For a few days at the end of July, however, this scenic corner of one of the world's most beautiful countries experiences an invasion.

title: How the crypto fallout could affect you
description: The crypto industry is still reeling from last week's shocking death spiral of digital currency exchange FTX. The company's bankruptcy filing has left financial backers in the lurch — including the usual suspects in Silicon Valley, from Masayoshi Son's SoftBank to VC firm Sequoia.

title: First-time NASA spacewalkers will venture outside the space station
description: Things are about to get busy on the International Space Station as the first in a series of end-of-the-year spacewalks is set to kick off Tuesday morning.

title: No undefeated teams left in NFL in 2022, as the Philadelphia Eagles lose to the Washington Commanders, 32-21
description: And then there were none.

title: Kraft Heinz hopes stunts like hot dog popsicles and Velveeta martinis can help revive its iconic brands
description: Oscar Mayer. Velveeta. Capri Sun. Kraft Heinz CEO Miguel Patricio admits: Some of the company's iconic products had become "a little bit dusty."

title: US intelligence suggests Russia put off announcing Kherson retreat until after midterm elections
description: The US has intelligence that Russia may have delayed announcing its withdrawal from the Ukrainian city of Kherson in part to avoid giving the Biden administration a political win ahead of the midterm elections, according to four people familiar with the intelligence.

title: Crowd breaks down street barriers as anger over China's Covid restrictions boils over
description: Residents under Covid lockdown in China's southern manufacturing hub of Guangzhou have torn down barriers meant to confine them to their homes, taking to the streets in defiance of strictly enforced local orders, according to video and images circulating on social media. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

title: US intercepts shipment of explosive material going from Iran to Yemen
description: US Naval Forces intercepted a "large quantity" of explosive material in the Gulf of Oman heading to Yemen from Iran last week, according to a statement from US Naval Forces Central Command.

title: The world's most expensive restaurant experience comes to Dubai
description: Dubai is known around the world as a center for fabulous indulgence and ambitious innovation and its restaurant scene is no different. 		A seemingly incessant wave of new openings has confirmed its place as one of the planet's finest places to dine out.

title: How the 'world's most famous football' became a 'gift from God' for former referee Ali Bin Nasser
description: The two goals are perhaps as famous as each other -- the first fabled for its audacity and guile, the second for its brilliant, breathtaking skill.

title: Trump is on the defense as he prepares for expected 2024 announcement
Amateur historian discovers 600-year-old English coin in Newfoundland
description: The discovery of a rare gold coin on the south coast of Newfoundland, Canada, may challenge traditional historical narratives about the timing of European contact in the region, as it predates explorer John Cabot's arrival on the island by at least 70 years.

title: Trump's quest to return to the Oval Office could face untold obstacles
description: Should Donald Trump announce his third presidential bid on Tuesday, as is widely expected, he will begin the next phase of his political career under siege.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo says Manchester United owners 'don't care about the club'
description: No one seems safe from Cristiano Ronaldo's wrath at the moment.

title: Plant-based milk is better than dairy for the planet, research shows, but nutritionally it's complicated
description: When it comes to which milk is better for the planet — dairy or plant-based — environmentalists will say there's no dispute: Milk made from plants wins every time.

title: The company making steaks out of thin air
description: It was space travel that inspired scientist Lisa Dyson to create an unusual climate solution: protein made from air, which can be grown inside a tank instead of using up valuable land.

title: Who is Binance founder Changpeng 'CZ' Zhao, the billionaire who wants to 'rebuild' crypto?
description: Binance founder and CEO Changpeng Zhao is once again in the global spotlight, this time as the self-appointed white knight of crypto as the industry is embroiled in crisis.

title: The leader presented a 10-point plan in a video speech, which includes a tribunal for alleged Russian war crimes
description:
• US studying how to modify powerful armed drone as Ukrainian demand grows
• Wagner boss applauds murder of ex-fighter

title: Global population hits 8 billion as growth poses more challenges for the planet
description: The world's population will reach 8 billion people on Tuesday, representing a "milestone in human development" before birth rates start to slow, according to a projection from the United Nations.

title: The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine
Australia to overturn Djokovic visa ban, source says
description: Australia will overturn a three-year ban on champion tennis player Novak Djokovic entering the country, paving the way for the former world No. 1 to contest the 2023 Australian Open.

title: Republican Senator says his party as we have known it is dead
description: Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO) appeared to be edging away from former President Trump saying that the midterm elections were a "funeral for the Republican party as we know it." CNN's Harry Enten explains how Trump hurt the Republican party.

title: White teacher in Texas fired after telling students his race is 'the superior one'
description: A middle school teacher in Pflugerville, Texas, has been fired, district officials said Monday, after video was posted to social media showing the White teacher tell his students his race "is the superior one."

title: Warren Buffett's company buys $4 billion stake in Taiwanese chip giant TSMC
description: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company surged on Tuesday after Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway disclosed that it had purchased a $4.1 billion stake in one of the world's largest chipmakers.

title: Ted Cruz is 'pissed off' and blames Mitch McConnell
description: On his recent podcast, Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX) says he's "pissed off" about the Senate midterm election results and blames Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell for Republican's disappointing performance.

title: Hear what GOP campaign strategist said about Kari Lake after projected loss
description: CNN's Kyung Lah says Kari Lake's projected loss in the Arizona governor's race is in part due to Independent and moderate Republican voters rejecting Lake's rhetoric.

title: After a near three-year absence from the world stage, Chinese leader Xi Jinping is meeting counterparts from Australia, France and South Korea at the G20 Summit
Japan's economy shrinks for the first time in a year
description: Japan's economy unexpectedly shrank for the first time in a year in the third quarter, stoking further uncertainty about the outlook as global recession risks, a weak yen and higher import costs took a toll on household consumption and businesses.

title: Katie Hobbs defeats election denier in Arizona
description: Democrat Katie Hobbs will win Arizona's governor's race, CNN projects, defeating one of the most prominent defenders of former President Donald Trump's lies about the 2020 election.

title: 9 of the world's best wellness retreats
description: Being pummeled by strangers, soaked in aromatic waters, or encouraged to throw yoga shapes in beautiful surroundings isn't going to erase the problems of the past few years.

title: Xi and Biden cool the heat, but China and the US are still on collision course
Pence: 'I think we'll have better choices in the future' than Trump
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence said in a newly released interview clip that he and his family are giving "prayerful consideration" to whether he should run for president in 2024 and that the US will have "better choices in the future" than former President Donald Trump.

title: 'Explosive comments': CNN reporter breaks down Cristiano Ronaldo's claims in new interview
description: In an interview with Piers Morgan for TalkTV, Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo said he is being forced out by the club. CNN's Coy Wire reports.
